## News Review for datamatics

# Datamatics Business News Review

## Executive Summary

Datamatics achieved notable industry recognition during December 2025, with Datamatics Business Solutions winning the IBPM Solutions Provider of the Year Award for the APAC region from Pan Finance Magazine's Q4 2025 awards program ([source](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/12/18/3207502/0/en/Pan-Finance-Magazine-Announces-the-Q4-Release-and-Award-Winners-of-2025.html)), while subsidiary Lumina Datamatics secured its third consecutive Great Place to Work certification for 2025-26 with over 90% employee survey participation, placing it among only 527 certified companies out of 25,000 large Indian companies ([source](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/12/10/3202939/0/en/Lumina-Datamatics-Earns-Great-Place-To-Work-Certification-for-the-3rd-Successive-Year.html)). These developments underscore the company's market positioning in Intelligent Business Process Management solutions across Asia-Pacific markets while demonstrating organizational stability through sustained workplace culture recognition that may support talent retention in the competitive technology services sector.

## Key Developments

**Industry Recognition**: Datamatics Business Solutions received the IBPM Solutions Provider of the Year award for the APAC region on December 18, 2025, as part of Pan Finance Magazine's quarterly awards program recognizing excellence in Intelligent Business Process Management solutions.

**Workplace Culture**: Lumina Datamatics earned its third consecutive Great Place to Work certification valid from December 2025 through December 2026, achieving over 90% employee survey participation and ranking among the top 2% of large companies in India for workplace culture.

**Organizational Positioning**: Lumina Datamatics operates as a subsidiary providing digital Content Services, Retail Support Services, and Technology Solutions, claiming relationships with 8 of the top 10 academic publishers and 3 of the 5 largest retailers and marketplaces, supported by over 7,000 professionals across multiple countries.

## Market Context

The IBPM award positions Datamatics within the competitive Asia-Pacific market for business process management solutions, providing third-party validation that could enhance credibility for regional expansion efforts. The sustained workplace certification reflects broader industry challenges around talent retention in technology services, where companies compete for skilled professionals. These recognitions come during a period when organizations are increasingly focused on both technological capabilities and human capital management as competitive differentiators.

## Notable Quotes

Sameer Kanodia, Managing Director & CEO of Lumina Datamatics and Vice Chairman & CEO of TNQTech, stated: "We are truly honored to receive the Great Place To Work certification for the 3rd year in a row. This recognition reflects the values, ethics, and collaborative spirit that our team demonstrates every single day. It affirms that we are on the right path where trust, excellence, and employee well-being remain at the heart of everything we do." ([source](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/12/10/3202939/0/en/Lumina-Datamatics-Earns-Great-Place-To-Work-Certification-for-the-3rd-Successive-Year.html))

## Strategic Implications

The IBPM award enhances Datamatics' competitive positioning in the APAC region and may provide leverage for global market expansion, while the consecutive workplace certifications support talent acquisition and retention strategies in a competitive technology services environment. The combination of industry recognition for technical solutions and sustained employee satisfaction metrics suggests a balanced approach to business development that addresses both market competitiveness and operational sustainability. These developments may strengthen the company's ability to compete for enterprise clients requiring both technical expertise and organizational stability.

### Article 3: Lumina Datamatics Earns Great Place To Work® Certification for the 3rd Successive Year

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/brandhub/pr-release/lumina-datamatics-earns-great-place-to-work-certification-for-the-3rd-successive-year/article70383631.ece)

## Summary

Lumina Datamatics received its third consecutive Great Place to Work certification for 2025-26, with over 90% employee survey participation, placing it among 527 certified companies out of 25,000 large Indian companies. CEO Sameer Kanodia emphasized the recognition reflects company values and collaborative spirit. The company serves digital content services, retail support, and technology solutions to publishing and retail industries, claiming relationships with 8 of top 10 academic publishers and 3 of 5 largest retailers, supported by over 7,000 professionals across multiple countries.

## Executive Insights

**Sameer Kanodia, Managing Director & CEO, Lumina Datamatics, and Vice Chairman & CEO, TNQTech**

> "We are truly honored to receive the Great Place To Work® certification for the 3rd year in a row. This recognition reflects the values, ethics, and collaborative spirit that our team demonstrates every single day. It affirms that we are on the right path where trust, excellence, and employee well-being remain at the heart of everything we do."

*Context: Commenting on receiving third consecutive Great Place to Work certification*

*Significance: Demonstrates leadership focus on employee culture and retention in services business*

### Article 4: Lumina Datamatics Earns Great Place To Work® Certification for the 3rd Successive Year!

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/12/10/3202939/0/en/Lumina-Datamatics-Earns-Great-Place-To-Work-Certification-for-the-3rd-Successive-Year.html)

## Summary

Lumina Datamatics received Great Place To Work certification for the third consecutive year, with the 2025-26 certificate reflecting over 90% employee survey participation and placing the company among 527 certified organizations out of 25,000 large companies in India. CEO Sameer Kanodia emphasized the recognition validates the company's focus on trust, excellence, and employee well-being, positioning workplace culture as a differentiator in the competitive technology services market where the company serves major academic publishers and retailers globally with over 7,000 professionals across multiple countries.

## Executive Insights

**Sameer Kanodia, Managing Director & CEO, Lumina Datamatics, and Vice Chairman & CEO, TNQTech**

This recognition reflects the values, ethics, and collaborative spirit that our team demonstrates every single day. It affirms that we are on the right path where trust, excellence, and employee well-being remain at the heart of everything we do."

*Context: Commenting on receiving Great Place To Work certification*
